text: cherry tomatoes are one of my favorites
especially in the summer months when
they are so sweet and wonderful but you
can now get them year-round and they're
really tasty and this recipe is a way to
just sort of shine them up make them
their best this is a roasted tomato
sauce another great healthy flavor
booster just to keep in your fridge you
can put it on everything and I really
mean everything so start with 1 pound 6
ounces of cherry tomatoes I'm leaving
some of these little stem guys on
because I think they're cute for garnish
you can of course take them off and I
want to mash up 3 cloves of garlic just
a quick little smash this is going to
keep the clove intact while it bakes
it's going to bake for about an hour at
a low temperature but it'll also release
all the delicious essential oils now
we're going to work on the marinade I
have half a cup of olive oil to that 2
tablespoons of balsamic vinegar this
adds a nice punchy acidity 2 teaspoons
of light brown sugar this is going to
really coax out the sweetness in our
Tomatoes also help them caramelize 1
teaspoon of fresh thyme leaves and a
teaspoon of coarse salt to help round
everything out give it a good whisk you
can just do this right in the measuring
cup no need to get out another bowl and
drizzle it over the tomatoes and garlic
give this a little toss around and that
is it so these are going to bake at 325
for about an hour until the tomatoes are
just shriveled and caramelized tomatoes
are beautifully roasted lots of
delicious pan juices let this tomato
mixture cool completely before
transferring to an airtight container
you can store in your fridge for about a
week or you can just hop right in and
make yourself a little crostini like I'm
going to do today this is basically a
really quick delicious breakfast snack
light dinner pair it with a salad you
can eat it any time so take a little bit
of fresh ricotta and I have toasted
whole grain bread here slather that on
ricotta is so great it's not only creamy
and delicious but
great source of calcium and protein now
to our tomato mixture so these garlic
cloves here are nice and tender and
juicy and ready to be used you can
either add it to this mixture you can
save it add it to your favorite
dressings super versatile and some sauce
just going to season the ricotta with a
little bit of flaky sea salt which adds
a nice amount of crunch and some red
pepper flakes let's go ahead and give
this a slice I might even go down again
perfect breakfast snack dinner option
Tomatoes all day all year hmm keep this
homemade sauce stocked in your fridge
